reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed at the Rodd Mill River for my good friend's wedding this past weekend. I've been there many times in the past for family events, but not within the last 5-6 years. I was looking forward to returning to the resort, but was very disappointed with the quality of the stay.
reviews.title: Definitely NOT worth the price

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We paid $135 plus tax for the room and there wasn't even a mini fridge. The decor, like most Rodd hotels in PEI, was terribly dated and needs a fine upgrade. TV was obviously 15 years old and the bathroom counter was wood panel! The state of this room may have been acceptable if it had been an $89 room, but not at the price we paid.
reviews.title: Some good points, some bad

reviews.text: Though the front desk staff was very friendly and accommodating, the restaurant was terrible. We had the breakfast buffet, minus the buffet. The tables were all full (on a Friday morning) and with only two servers the kitchen couldn't keep up. There was literally no food at the buffet for 90% of our time there. Not even toast or juice. We each paid $15 for nothing... plus one of the servers was pretty frigging rude.
reviews.title: A wonderful resort hotel in beautiful Prince Edward Island

reviews.text: Of course I'll try the resort again... It's a staple of Island hospitality. The golf course is fantastic, but I'll probably camp next time!
reviews.title: Lovely

reviews.text: We stayed here in July 2010. We had read the reviews and thought it would be a great place to stay.
reviews.title: I must return!!

reviews.text: I was truly disappointed in my stay at this hotel. I had stayed several years ago with my husband and young daughter and we loved it! So when we returned this summer with my two children and parents, I couldn't believe how run down this hotel had become. The bathrooms were in a state of disrepair and though the cleaning staff had obviously cleaned the fact that the chain has clearly chosen to "forget" about this hotel is evident throughout the property. Besides the bathrooms in the suites we stayed in there was evidence of it being a poorly maintained hotel. The carpet in the hallways was hazardous as it has many large ripples, door handles were falling off and the hot tub was broken with no signs of a repair in the near future. The staff were very friendly and willing to accomodate and I genuinely feel the Rodd chain of hotels has cast this one aside. For ten dollars more we stayed at Brudnelle the night before and wished we had stayed for another, it was far better and in a beautiful location.
reviews.title: let down

reviews.text: The hotel itself was very nice and clean. The food, however, was terrible. Took over one hour to get a platter of chicken wings. Then went to the "fine dining" only to discover that they had "run out" of everything - including lobster, scallops, bread, ice tea, etc. Terribly over-priced, for low quality food. Felt bad for the staff though. Wasn't their fault and they were taking the brunt of the complaints. Wouldn't return.
reviews.title: Nice hotel, but terrible food

reviews.text: Please be prepared to rent a car and drive out over 100 km from the airport. Sounds horrific, but if you want to really witness the beauty of PEI first hand, it is really worth staying here!!!
reviews.title: wonderful

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: On a recent Saturday afternoon, after a long drive across Nova Scotia from Halifax, my husband and I decided to detour to PEI for a look-see (we've never been to Canada). While driving across the bridge to PEI, I got out the good old AAA travel guide and started looking for a hotel to stay in, I thought PEI was like south eastern Maine with tons of hotels and motels to be found, wrong! After calling three motels/inns and finding them all booked, I chanced on the Rodd Mill River, the desk agent who took my call was very sweet and laughed when I was shocked at the reasonable $89 room rate (the lowest rate of our entire trip). I wasn't too optimistic, until we arrived to the beautiful resort. Our room was a beautiful, spacious kind bedded room overlooking the golf course. The room was clean, comfy and as I mentioned, reasonable. My husband thought it was cool that this was the place for "The Big Break" (some golf show), but was really ticked off that he didn't have his clubs. My regret is that we had to check out so early on Sunday and hit the road for the long ride home, I would have loved to hit the pool or maybe take a little kayak ride. I'd love to get back there again!
reviews.title: What a Find!!!!!

reviews.text: My Mom and I just got back from a wonderful holiday driving to Prince Edward Island and back and I wanted to post some information about a few of the hotels we stayed in.
reviews.title: THE BEST!!!

reviews.text: I was a bridesmaid in a wedding at this resort in the fall of 2011. I was excited as this hotel is considered 'fancy' in the area. Overall, I was not impressed at all with the service. The meal and bar service at the reception was great, but there were several other negatives. We stayed at the hotel the night before the wedding and paid extra so that we could check out of the suite anytime the day of the wedding. This was confirmed with the hotel a week before the wedding. Myself, and 3 other bridesmaids had booked rooms for the night of the wedding, and we confirmed with the hotel the week before the wedding, that we would be able to check into the rooms early on the day of the wedding. The reason for this was that the bridal party were all getting ready in the suite the day of the wedding, and wanted to be able to move things from one to another before we left for the wedding. This was also the purpose of paying extra (almost 40% of the cost of the suite) so that we could check out of the suite anytime that day - we didn't want to have to move everything from that room before we left for the wedding. Again, all this was confirmed with the hotel a week before and they assured us it would not be a problem. Needless to say, it was a problem, and NONE of the extra rooms were available for check in before we left for the wedding (1:30 pm). They also informed us we had to be checked out of the suite by 2 pm (which by 2 pm, we were walking down the aisle at the church). So that meant, 2 bridesmaids running up and down the stairs a dozen times moving things out of the suite and into another guest's room (also note - the hotel has 3 floors and NO elevator). This wedding took place in the off season, and essentially the only guests at the hotel that weekend were wedding guests, therefore the issue with the rooms couldn't have been lack of available rooms.
reviews.title: not very accomodating for a wedding...

reviews.text: Another issue is the hotel does not have air conditioning. This was a problem for us, as we all got ready in the suite, and had the hair and makeup people come to us, so for the entire morning, there was about 12 people in our suite. The room was very hot and that does not bode well for hairstyles and makeup. We contacted the front desk to see if they had a fan or anything to help us out, but no. Apparently they use window air conditioning units and they had all been removed the month before (the day of the wedding, it was 18 degrees out). It was a very hot morning in there, with no breeze coming in the window.
reviews.title: Extra Effort from Staff

reviews.text: The final issue was the morning after the wedding, check out is 11 am. 11 am is early, and so the bride and groom wanted a late checkout. I stay in hotels quite frequently and have never had a problem with calling for a late checkout. So the bride called the front desk to ask for a late check out (even an hour later), and was refused. So after spending nearly $4000 at their facility (not to mention all the hotel rooms booked, and money made during bar service), the front desk denied the bride and groom a late checkout. This was eventually rectified after an angry visit to the front desk manager.
reviews.title: That 70's Hotel

reviews.text: So overall, I was not at all impressed and would have a hard time recommending this facility to anyone for a wedding. The meal was delicious, and the service for the reception and dance was great, but that doesn't make up for the other issues. The service does not match the cost and so called status of this resort.
reviews.title: Would go back here again

reviews.text: We stayed 2 nights at the Rodd. Check in was smooth and very friendly. As a family they were quick to point out the few extras like free meal for kids, a beach ball for the pool, etc.
reviews.title: Fun,friendly,relaxing

reviews.text: What keeps the Rodd Mill River Resort from being "average" (or "poor")? Certainly it is the onsite golf course, which in my own opinion is one of the best in the Atlantic Provinces. Also, it is the onsite pool area... a fun spot for any family. However, apart of the onsite resort amenities, the rooms are clean and adequate however they are showing their age. I doubt that there has been much in terms of upgrades, and any time/money spent on the rooms was for replacement or maintenance. One might find it easy to wake up in the morning believing that you are in a hotel from the 1990s as the decor and room amenities are certainly not trendy or the latest industry norms. The rooms still feature tube televisions, window A/C units (loud!), wall-paper and a push carpet. However, I must say that the hotel has done a fair job keeping the rooms clean and in full working order. The onsite restaurant is good and fairly priced. The staff is very friendly and certainly display "island hospitality". No doubt the resort's hay-day was many years ago, but you can still find a good place to stay and an absolute amazing golf course at Rodd Mill River Resort.
reviews.title: Clean & Adequate but Showing Age

reviews.text: Nothing really inherently wrong with this place...just really dated..from furniture, bedding, the whole look and feel of the place. Front staff were not knowledgeable about places to eat in the vicinity other than the overpriced restaurant within the hotel itself. This is a golf resort...cannot comment on the golfing...we were just needing a hotel for the night. Got a very good price so am not complaining but there normal rate was listed at $179 I think, which would be crazy.
reviews.title: Likely an awesome place 20 years ago, dated now

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: They did have a nice pool with slide and hot tub. My son enjoyed the slide and the pool water was surprisingly not cold like most hotel pools. In fact, if it were not for the aquatic facility I would have given it one less rating.
reviews.title: Great dining

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Place was clean and comfortable.
reviews.title: Family Friendly

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My spouse and I recently had a very nice evening meal at Rodd's. The server was very attentive and helpful with the menu selections. My spouse had a chicken wrap and I had a club, both came with a mushroom, steak and potato soup that was the best we have ever tasted. The desert was a turtle cheeze cake and carrot cake drizzled with caramel sauce. Amazing!! We sat in the pub section and watched the late golfers coming in as the 18th hole is near the resort. Had an amazing dinner as well as a great view. Well done!!
reviews.title: Great spot in remote PEI, slightly dated hotel.
